negotiator.logging

Class XmlLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.logging.XmlLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Listener<NegotiationEvent>

    public class XmlLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listener<NegotiationEvent>, java.io.Closeable
    Creates a logger which will log NegotiationEvents to a XML file. Logs the MultipartySessionEndedEvent.

      • agentLogs

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> agentLogs

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlLogger

        public XmlLogger(java.io.OutputStream out,
                 java.lang.String topLabel)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Parameters:
        out - OutputStream to write the log to. If this is a file, we recommend to use the extension ".xml". This logger becomes owner of this outputstream and will close it eventually.
        topLabel - the top level label to use in the output file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange(NegotiationEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: Listener
        a notification call that occurs when something changed. Consult the parent object for details about this event.

        NOTICE 1

        notifications run in the thread of the caller. The caller will be blocked until this callback has been completed. It is therfore good practice to handle callbacks quickly.

        NOTICE 2

        Notifications often cross a thread sarety boundary. For example when in MVC a model (typically thread safe) calls back a panel (not thread safe). The called side (the panel) thus must handle the callback in a thread safe manner, e.g. using SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable). We recommend to avoid synchronize as this will can block indefinitely (see notice 1) which might lead to deadlocks.
        Specified by:
        notifyChange in interface Listener<NegotiationEvent>
        Parameters:
        e - additional data, typically the new value associated with the event
